alert.note: Alert for Charles (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:30PM EDT until August 30 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CHARLES...STAFFORD...WEST CENTRAL KING GEORGE... SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE WILLIAM AND SPOTSYLVANIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FREDERICKSBURG... At 429 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Stafford to 7 miles north of Bumpass, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Stafford, Fredericksburg, Quantico, Potomac Creek, Aquia Creek, Triangle, Dumfries, Massaponax, Spotsylvania, Cherry Hill, Falmouth, Passapatanzy, Stones Corner, Roseville, Garrisonville, Snell, Ramoth, Partlow, Thornburg and White Oak. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
